question_body: From what Italian tribe did Rome's second king, Numa Pompilius come?
Under which famed lawyer did Cicero, along with his friend Atticus, apprentice?
In 406, Rome began a 10-year long war against which neighboring city?
During the Battle of Vesuvius in 340, which Roman commander executed his own son for refusing to follow orders?
According to Plutarch, who was the first to stab at Caesar on that fateful day in March?
According to some sources, Rome's sixth king, Servius Tullius, was actually an Etruscan mercenary named ______________?
What engineering feat—used first at the Battle of Mylae—aided Rome's navy during the First Punic War?
Who is the mother of Tiberius & Gaius Gracchus?
Where, in 207, did Claudius Nero and Livius Salinator defeat Hasdrubal?
Who was the king of Numidia against whom Rome waged a series of wars from 111-104?
Who was #10's father-in-law who betrayed him to the Romans, sealing Roman victory?
Which king of Rome is credited for settling an entire town—Palitorium—on the Aventine Hill?
What is the name given to the board of commissioners who put forth Rome's Tables?
What tribe's incursion into Sicily hastened the beginning of the First Punic War?
Which of Caesar's trusted lieutenants abandoned him right before crossing the Rubicon so that he could bring warning to Rome?
Who was the Roman general who defeated Perseus at the battle of Pydna in 168?
Who was the Vestal Virgin who let invading Sabines into Rome for mere bracelets—and was summarily trampled by the Sabines as they entered?
After exiling himself, Hannibal aided which Seleucid king in his preparations for war on Rome?
Cincinnatus' son, ___________, was put on trial for murder, absconded on bail, and left his father to pay an exorbitant fine.
What animal is Pyrrhus credited as the first to bring to Italy to fight the Romans?
What Roman commander is known for putting down Spartacus' slave revolt?
Before which battle in 45 B.C. did the omen of a palm shoot sprouting overnight convince Caesar to adopt Octavian as his heir?
The rape of which woman ignited the war against Tarquin the Proud and led to the installation of the Roman Republic?
At the Battle of Silva Arsia, Lucius Junius Brutus simultaneously died while locked in combat with which son of Tarquin the Proud?
During the 2nd Punic War, what Greek scientist/mathematician helped his native Syracuse repulse Roman attacks?
Which law authorized Pompey's command against Mithradates VI?
Who was Romulus' Sabine wife?
In 222, Marcus Claudius Marcellus defeated which Gallic chieftain to receive that last Spolia Opima?
Which of the following DID NOT occur during the course of 63?
Who defeated an advancing army of Boii near Lake Vadimo in 283?
After which battle in 216 B.C. did Hannibal's cavalry commander, Maharbal, remark, "You, Hannibal, know how to gain a victory; you do not know how to use it?"
Clodius Pulcher had a vendetta against Cicero following the orator's use of power in the Catilinarian Conspiracy. Who physically protected Cicero from Pulcher's gang of thugs?
Which king's run-in with the Sibyl of Cumae resulted in obtaining only three of the nine Sibylline Books?
What mythological characters are said to have fought for Rome at the Battle of Lake Regillus?
Caesar's second invasion of Britain was primarily spent subduing which warlord from north of the Thames?
At the end of the 3rd Punic War, which city became the capital of the new Roman province of Africa?
When the Celts invaded Rome in 390, the Romans took shelter in the citadel. They knew to do this because who had heard the honking of Juno's geese?
At what battle of the Third Samnite War did another Publius Decius Mus perform his devotio?
What Carthaginian leader, against Hamilcar's advice, advocated abandonment of the 1st Punic War (he also did the same during the 2nd Punic War!)?
What Consul was granted power under the first senatus consultum ultimum to go after the followers of C. Gracchus in 121?
Who was the offspring of the union between Julius Caesar and Cleopatra?
Which of the following DID NOT happen in 133?

question_options.B: Attalus III gave his kingdom to Rome

question_body: After Cannae, which king of Macedon allied himself with Hannibal, thus igniting the concurrent First Macedonian War?
Of the following, which WAS NOT a tribe whom Camillus was elected dictator to defeat?
At the onset of the 1st Samnite War, what city cleverly forced Rome to protect it from the Samnites by surrending the city entirely to Rome?
What is the name of the bridge upon which Horatius Cocles made his famous stand?
What law of 445 finally allowed patricians and plebeians to intermarry?
Who was the first Plebeian to serve as Censor in 351?
Who was the Gallic chieftain who first defeated, but was ultimately defeated by Caesar at the Battle of Alesia?
Who was the father of #49 who had tried to unite Celts under one banner and was executed by his own tribesmen for trying to fight Caesar?
